1453428156648632321.text:
@LCVoters @COP26 We need the largest emitters to set stronger commitments for reducing emissions, and back them up with new policy, regulation, and investments.

1309909503085817857.text: Make no mistake, ICE wouldn’t allow MOC to take phones into Irwin to record these women in their own words (with a signed privacy release) because they are emotional, horrifying and inhumane. They don’t want the public to hear their pain, happening at hands of the US government

1309907908629585920.text: Women at Irwin County detention described a disturbing pattern that many who visited a doctor for Gyno/OBGYN issues came back worse. One lady got so bad her belly turned blue.  Women cried as they talked about her pain. She was released Wednesday, before MOC arrived.

1309892850155491329.text: She was sobbing asking for help. Afraid to see a doctor here. Was told she needed a procedure. She asked for a second opinion and sent to a mental health doctor instead.

1309892846393098241.text: One detainee showed me a medical document and said they gave me injections. I don’t know what for and I didn’t authorize it. Read this and tell me. The document was for a “Depo Provera Injection”. After receiving it she began bleeding and experienced terrible pain for 42 days.

1309890417719152643.text:
Spoke to women detained in ICE’s prison here in Irwin County about the horrors they face.

Many more wrote letters, because they were afraid to speak up or because we didn’t have enough time to talk to everyone. (And delayed for not allowing phones)

Their stories break my heart. https://t.co/FJA4rrc6L9

1309884270543020032.text: Just one of many sketches by the migrant women here at Irwin detention/prison. Some calling for freedom. But their stories of mistreatment and fear, horrific. Couldn’t help but cry with them. https://t.co/EMLEyMfpDd

1309879727465865226.text: Just finished an oversight visit at the ICE facility in Irwin County. Here’s what I saw  https://t.co/4zoEOWR1cC

1309862680187015173.text: ICE threatens to not allow Members in if we insist on our phones. Looks like we need to write this into an apropps bill. Members of Congress should be able to take in our phones. Others in the facility have their phones but not us? What’s there to hide?

1309854937766146048.text:
Arrived at Irwin County’s ICE “Detention Facility.” We should just call it a prison, because that’s what it is. 
 The reports of the unnecessary medical procedures on women here is terrifying. 
 Will talk with women detainees, and continue this investigation. More after. https://t.co/BrquEAXvmJ

1309852647554535425.text: First fight will be on whether Members of Congress can keep our phones. If women signed a privacy release, what’s the problem?  Telling the story of what is happening in these facilities is important. Members should be able to keep phones during oversight visit.

1309851354983170048.text: Minutes from the Irwin County ICE detention facility. ICE officials will come aboard our bus to do temperature checks before letting us inside. Hope to spend as much time talking to women to hear their stories. As you can imagine, ICE cleans up before we arrive & filters info.

1309807661957951488.text: Early morning here in GA as our delegation begins the 3 hour drive to Irwin County to conduct our oversight visit of @ICEgov facility run by LaSalle. For profit private contractors like LaSalle have track record of abuses that should not happen to anyone in government custody.

1309658395251806210.text:
Landed in ATL & met with whistleblower nurse Dawn Wooten.

Tomorrow, @HispanicCaucus & @HouseJudiciary members will head out to investigate reported abuse at ICE’s Irwin County Detention Center. The allegations from those detained at this facility are horrific. 

We need answers. https://t.co/EOFGukTb1W
